Class Save

java.lang.Object
Save
public class Save extends Object
This class represents the format used to save files in .gds. The file format is as follows: Each line of the file corresponds to an index number, where the first line starts from 1 and the title corresponds to the int value at index 0. Format:
  • 0 - Title (int)
  • 1 - Seed (int)
  • 2 - List (String)
  • 3 - Progress (int)
  • 4 - History (List<String>)
  • 5 - Percentage (int)
Explanations:
  • Seed - The post-hash number used to generate the order of the list.
  • List - The selected list, ex. "Demon-list".
  • Progress - The number of levels completed so far, ex. 5.
  • History - The percentage completion of the levels so far.
  • Percentage - The current percentage to go far.
This class provides a foundational structure for storing `.gds` files, including the title, seed, list, progress, history, and percentage data. It offers the basic methods for accessing and modifying this data as it's loaded and created. However, this class is not responsible for complex data processing tasks, which are intended to be handled by other components of the application, such as FM.
